revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2018}} {{Infobox person | image = Seann William Scott 2012.jpg | caption = Seann at the [[Sydney]] premiere of ''[[American Reunion]]'' in 2012 | birth_name = Seann William Scott | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1976|10|3}} | birth_place = [[Cottage Grove, Minnesota]], U.S. | othername = Sean W. Scott, Stifler (After his character in ''American Pie'') | occupation = Actor, comedian, producer | years active = 1996–present }} '''Seann William Scott''' (born 3 October 1976) is an American actor, comedian, and producer. His most recognized roles are [[Steve Stifler]] in the ''[[American Pie (series)|American Pie]]'' film series (1999–2012) and Doug Glatt in both ''[[Goon (film)|Goon]]'' (2011) and ''[[Goon: Last of the Enforcers]]'' (2017). He has also starred in films including ''[[Final Destination (film)|Final Destination]]'' (2000), ''[[Road Trip (film)|Road Trip]]'' (2000), ''[[Dude, Where's My Car?]]'' (2000), ''[[Evolution (2001 film)|Evolution]]'' (2001), ''[[The Rundown]]'' (2003), ''[[The Dukes of Hazzard (film)|The Dukes of Hazzard]]'' (2005), ''[[Role Models]]'' (2008), and ''[[Cop Out (2010 film)|Cop Out]]'' (2010). He voiced Crash the opossum in four theatrical films and two television specials within the ''[[Ice Age (franchise)|Ice Age]]'' series (2006–2016). ==Early life== Seann was born in [[Cottage Grove, Minnesota]]. He is the son of Patricia Anne ([[Married and maiden names|née]] Simons), a homemaker, and William Frank Scott, a factory worker. Seann is the youngest of seven children. He has [[English Americans|English]], [[Irish Americans|Irish]], [[Scottish Americans|Scottish]], and [[German Americans|German]] ancestry. ==Career== [[File:Seann William Scott TIFF 2011.jpg|thumb|150px|right|Seann in 2011]] Seann's first commercial success came with the 1999 film ''[[American Pie (film)|American Pie]]'', as [[Steve Stifler]], a role he reprised in three sequels, ''[[American Pie 2]]'' (2001), ''[[American Wedding]]'' (2003), and ''[[American Reunion]]'' (2012).{{cite news|first=Joshua L.|last=Weinstein|url=http://www.thewrap.com/movies/article/american-pie-4-gets-may-start-date-25535|title=Exclusive: Jason Biggs, Seann William Scott, Eugene Levy Reunite for New 'American Pie'|publisher=[[The Wrap]]|date=16 March 2011|accessdate=1 April 2011}} For his supporting role in the first film, Seann was paid only $8,000.an interview with Scott on [[BBC Radio 1]] Seann was granted the lead role in ''American Wedding'', though he only received second billing, and the character propelled him into the public consciousness. Seann's fear of [[Typecasting (acting)|typecasting]] led him to play different types of characters post-''American Pie'', such as a hapless nerd in the horror film ''[[Final Destination (film)|Final Destination]]'' and a friendly stoner in ''[[Dude, Where's My Car?]]''. He also appeared in the film ''[[Bulletproof Monk]]''. Seann appeared in [[Kevin Smith]]'s ''[[Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back]]'' as a guitar-playing animal rights activist, and had a starring part as a police officer in ''[[Southland Tales]]'', where he reunited with [[Dwayne Johnson|Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson]], with whom he had previously worked in ''[[The Rundown]]''. Seann hosted the [[MTV Movie Awards 2003]] with [[Justin Timberlake]]. The two performed several skits, including scenes from ''[[The Matrix Reloaded]]'', which are on ''The Matrix Reloaded'' DVD. He has also hosted ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' and appeared as a guest co-host on ''[[Live with Regis and Kelly]]''. He voiced the character Crash in ''[[Ice Age: The Meltdown]]'' and reprised his role in its sequel ''[[Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs]]'' (2009) and ''[[Ice Age: Continental Drift]]'' (2012). He co-starred in the action comedy ''[[Cop Out (2010 film)|Cop Out]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.empireonline.com/news/story.asp?NID=24914|title=Seann W Scott new action comedy|work=Empire}} In 2011 he starred in the [[Sports film|sports]] [[comedy film]] [[Goon (film)|Goon]] as Doug 'The Thug' Glatt.{{Cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1456635/|title=Goon (2011)|publisher=IMDb}} In 2012, he starred in [[Movie 43]] in the segment 'Happy Birthday.{{citation needed|date=July 2015}} Seann reprised his role as 'Steve Stifler in 2012 [[American Reunion]]. On October 2 2013, Seann guest-starred in Episode 5, Season 9 (entitled "Mac Day") of the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] television series ''[[It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia]]'', playing Mac's cousin, "Country Mac." In 2014 he starred in the [[Comedy-drama|comedy-drama film]], ''[[Just Before I Go]]'' as Ted Morgan.{{citation needed|date=July 2015}} He reprised his roles as Crash in ''[[Ice Age: Collision Course]]'' (2016){{Cite news|url=https://parade.com/493364/joshwigler/ice-age-producer-teases-collision-course-follow-up/|title=Ice Age Producer Teases Collision Course Follow-Up|last=Wigler|first=Josh|work=Parade|access-date=10 April 2017|language=en}} and Doug 'The Thug' Glatt in ''[[Goon: Last of the Enforcers]]''{{cite web|last=Evry |first=Max |url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/448317-elisha-cuthbert-joins-seann-william-scott-in-goon-last-of-the-enforcers |title=Elisha Cuthbert Joins Seann William Scott in Goon: Last of the Enforcers |publisher=ComingSoon.net |date=8 June 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} (2017).{{Cite web|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2017/03/14/seann-william-scott-ups-his-game-for-goon-last-of-the-enforcers|title=Seann William Scott ups his game for ‘Goon: Last of the Enforcers’|website=Toronto Sun|access-date=10 April 2017}} Seann made a cameo appearance as a Vermont State Trooper in the 2018 film sequel, ''[[Super Troopers 2]].'' On May 13, 2018, it was announced that Scott was cast in [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]]'s ''[[Lethal Weapon (TV series)|Lethal Weapon]]'' as a new character named Wesley Cole replacing [[Clayne Crawford]] as [[Martin Riggs]] as the new series lead.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2018/05/seann-william-scott-cast-lethal-weapon-replace-clayne-crawford-out-series-renewed-season-3-fox-1202388143/|title=‘Lethal Weapon’: Seann William Scott To Replace Clayne Crawford; Series Renewed For Season 3 By Fox|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|publisher=Deadline|date=May 13, 2018|accessdate=May 14, 2018}} ==Personal life== On March 16 2011, Seann was admitted to a treatment facility for "health and personal issues". His representatives declined to confirm any details about the decision, including specifying the facility.{{cite web|author=Kristin Watson |url=http://www.sheknows.com/entertainment/articles/826395/american-pie-star-seann-william-scott-enters-treatment-facility |title=American Pie star Seann William Scott enters treatment facility |publisher=Sheknows.com |date=16 March 2011 |accessdate=19 January 2012}} On 13 April, it was reported that Seann had successfully completed the treatment program.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Seann-William-Scott-Rehab-1031816.aspx |title=Seann William Scott Exits Rehab – Today's News: Our Take |work=TV Guide |date=13 April 2011 |accessdate=19 January 2012}} In March 2012, Seann confirmed that he was engaged to model [[Lindsay Frimodt]].{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20580057,00.html|title=Seann William Scott: I'm Engaged |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date=20 March 2012 |accessdate=20 March 2012}} In January 2013, ''[[US Weekly]]'' reported that this engagement had ended and that the two had split, but would remain friends.{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/seann-william-scott-fiancee-lindsay-frimodt-split-end-engagement-2013251|title=Seann W Scott Fianccee Lindsay Frimodt Split End Engagement|publisher=US Weekly}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
